description: tzedakah box; transparent glass box; gash-like opening on top extending to front side; concrete door or hearth-like structure inside against back wall; aqua-green metal (aluminum?) piggy bank lying inside; wood base and back painted black
text: This tzedakah box was selected for the second place award from forty-two entries in a juried exhibition.  The artists combined architectural fragments from a synagogue in Polna, Czech Republic with a metal tzedakah box of the type traditionally used in American households.  The combination is symbolic: "For those whose giving was forever taken.  All Israel are responsible for one another."
title: Niche for a Charity Box
